DataElement.preferredName: Neck Computed Tomography Magnetic Resonance Imaging Diagnostic Imaging Performed Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The date related to a series of detailed pictures of areas inside the body or a procedure in which a magnet linked to a computer is used to create detailed pictures of areas inside the body being performed for the neck._the date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Neck Computed Tomography Magnetic Resonance Imaging Diagnostic Imaging Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The date related to a series of detailed pictures of areas inside the body or a procedure in which a magnet linked to a computer is used to create detailed pictures of areas inside the body being performed for the neck.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Neck Computed Tomography Magnetic Resonance Imaging Diagnostic Imaging
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The region that connects the head to the rest of the body.:A method of examining structures within the body by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.:Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders. :Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation..

Concepts.definition: The region that connects the head to the rest of the body.
A method of examining structures within the body by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.

Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.
Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/3/17 tt added Diagnosis CSI. 6/20/17 jk transferred to NCI Standards per confirmation by Brian Campbell as part of Round 5 finalization task, added reg status.
